ACT
156.  
Divisible property
The property which co-successors acquire on the basis of rights belonging to the estate or out of the estate or as compensation for the destruction of, damage to or seizure of objects included in the estate forms part of an estate. The provisions of §§ 162-164 of this Act apply upon division of an estate.
The benefit shall be allocated only upon the division of the estate. If division is precluded for longer than one year, a co-successor may demand allocation of net income at the end of each year.
For division of an estate, the successors are required to disclose information necessary for determination of the divisible property and for division of the estate.
